metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29974 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When network partitioning was enabled, e.g. as a result of Enhanced Tracking Protection settings, a TLS error page would allow the user to override an error on a domain which had specified HTTP Strict Transport Security (which implies that the error should not be override-able.) This issue did not affect the network connections, and they were correctly upgraded to HTTPS automatically. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 90.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29974` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
